Boston.com
10

Ex-BU hockey player pleads guilty to assaulting woman

Corey Trivino was sentenced to two years probation after pleading guilty to assault and battery charges for attacking a woman in her dorm room. (Globe, 2:27 p.m.)
  • Survey Is the sentence for Trivino fair?
  • 2/23 BU investigates hockey culture after charges
  • 12/14/11 Trivino kicked off team after assault charges

Raisman captures another gold medal

Needham's Aly Raisman won gold in the floor exercise and won the bronze medal in the beam. (Globe, 12:19 p.m.)
  • US men rout Argentina | US women in water polo final
  • Pictures Olympic scenes | Quinn: Boston as host?
  • TV schedule  |  Medals  |  Olympics blog  |  More

Aly Raisman's big day at the Olympics

Raisman, the Needham gymnast and the US women's gymnastics captain, won gold in the floor exercise and bronze on balance beam today.
  • Needham celebrates Raisman's wins | Pictures
  • Share Congratulate Aly Raisman on her Olympic victories

Loughner pleads guilty to Ariz. shooting rampage

Jared Lee Loughner pleaded today to killing six and wounding 13 in 2011 , including then-Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords. (AP, 3:50 p.m.)

Warren backs off Brown on tax returns

Elizabeth Warren backed off demands for Scott Brown to release more tax returns after it was revealed he had already released six years' worth. (Globe, 12:16 p.m.)
